result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lee Hackett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

*No firearms; weapons.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling .
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*PARENTING CLASSES.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
Defendant picked up 12-28-2015 on Warrant issued 11-13-2015 and CANCELLED on 11-17-2015.  Cancelled Warrant in file.  sdg
Order For Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court received, signed, and filed with court.

Commitment is issued forthwith directing the Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take the said Defendant into custody to spend 30 days, straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation.  Order received, signed, and filed with the court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Robert Lee Hackett not in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court is in receipt of probation review report from agent.  Defendant is in absconder status.  Court ordered the 30 day stayed condition time imposed FORTHWITH.  Upon cancellation of Defendant's apprehension warrant, Agent to advise the Court if any future review dates are necessary.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Robert Lee Hackett in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Robert Lee Hackett in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to negotiations, court orders counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in for sentencing.
AS to counts 1 and 4:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.
AS to count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence,  with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling .
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. PARENTING CLASSES.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court orders that the costs, assessments and surcharges imposed on count 4 are payable during this probation term.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
AS to count 4:  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 63 days time served, HUBER privileges.  Court orders all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation ordered in count 1.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Judge held off the record conversation with the parties in chambers.  The court hearing scheduled for 08/18/2015 at 8:15 was cancelled. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 08/19/2015 at 8:15am in Branch 38.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Robert L Hackett not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests adjourned Final Pretrial. Court grants defense request. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 8/19/2015 at 8:15 am. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Attorney T R Williams in court, defendant Robert L Hackett not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing. Defense no longer wishes to argue bail. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Final Pretrial & Jury Trial date. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sherrell D or Victoria D

Defendant Robert Lee Hackett in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Robert Lee Hackett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
